author: The Destati

text: Yes, it's mostly mix of techo and new age music. The NA version was composed by Ashif Hakik (The Digital Bitphonic Orchestra).
author: Arun Krishnamurthy

text: One of the PS2's launch titles, I remember looking at the box and finding it completely unappealing. I was sure it was one of those terrible launch games. To my surprise, the critics were actually pretty good (though some people really hated it). It's a puzzle game with a different soundtrack for each region (Japan, Europe, North America). The NA version's OST had more of a new age style.
author: SupraDarky

text: I remember when my parents got me my PS2.  I don't remember what games we got, but I do know I had some great times playing games from the Jak series (Jak 2 is the best in the series) and that was really the only big name games  that I had for this system.
author: Eric C.

text: +SupraDarky Same here! I ended up getting Theme Park Rollercoaster instead. Fortunately for me, I also picked up FFVIII.
